greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 5*a(n-1) - 6*a(n-2) + a(n-3) with a(0)=1, a(1)=0, a(2)=-2.
comment: The Berndt-type sequence number 10 for the argument 2Pi/7 defined by the first trigonometric relation from section "Formula". For additional informations and particularly connections with another sequences of trigonometric nature - see comments to A215512 (a(n) is equal to the sequence c(n) in these comments) and Witula-Slota's reference (Section 3).
The following summation formula hold true (see comments to A215512): Sum{k=3,..,n} a(k) = 5*a(n-1) - a(n-2) + 1, n=3,4,...
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Roman Witula and Damian Slota, New Ramanujan-Type Formulas and Quasi-Fibonacci Numbers of Order 7, Journal of Integer Sequences, Vol. 10 (2007), Article 07.5.6
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (5,-6,1).
program: (MAGMA) I:=[1,0,-2]; [n le 3 select I[n] else 5*Self(n-1) - 6*Self(n-2) + Self(n-3): n in [1..30]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 25 2018
xref: Cf. A215512 (the inverse binomial transform, up to signs), A215694.
results.author: _Roman Witula_, Aug 21 2012
